meanings.definition: To slip over or past something.
meanings.sent1: The cat overslips the puddle on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The paper overslips the edge of the table and falls to the floor.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel overslips the sleeping dog without waking it up.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter overslips the noise of the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight overslips the dark clouds, brightening the sky.

meanings.definition: To slide or pass over something.
meanings.sent1: The toy car overslips the small bump in the road.
meanings.sent2: The skater overslips gracefully across the ice.
meanings.sent3: The magician overslips the coin from one hand to the other.
meanings.sent4: The melody overslips smoothly from one note to the next.
meanings.sent5: The shadow overslips the corner, disappearing into darkness.

meanings.sent1: Her score overslips his by just one point.
meanings.sent2: The new model overslips the previous one in terms of features.
meanings.sent3: The cake overslips all expectations with its delicious taste.
meanings.sent4: His kindness overslips any other quality he possesses.
meanings.sent5: The athlete overslips the finish line, breaking the record.
